page.title: 13HOUSING AND LANDSCAPE
page.content: Naunton Beauchamp is a typical example of the buildings and landscape to be found in this area. Local lias stone is used in Naunton Court and in various local barns and pig styes. The very mixed housing consists of 5 timbered houses, 2 thatchings,1 Victorian house (once a pair of cottages), 1 large Georgian farmhouse, a Smithy dated 1865, 4 Agricultural Council (workers) houses circa 193O, 3O modern properties and 1 'Colt'type bungalow. The church also is built of Blue Lias. The whole area is a landscape of gently sloping countryside; pasture and fallow fields with the odd clump of trees, a few isolated farmhouses and the four villages.
